quizSynopsis: Test your understanding of the DevOps Capstone Project planning, requirements gathering, implementation, and review phases.

questions.question: Which of the following should be the first step in a DevOps capstone project?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Requirements gathering is the first step.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Requirements gathering should be the first step.

questions.question: What is the goal of the requirements phase?
answers: To identify functional and non-functional requirements
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The requirements phase involves identifying functional and non-functional requirements.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The correct goal is to identify functional and non-functional requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of the project planning phase?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Defining success metrics is part of the requirements phase, not planning.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Success metrics are not part of planning but are defined during the requirements phase.

questions.question: What is an MVP approach in the context of a DevOps project?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! MVP stands for Minimum Viable Product.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. MVP stands for Minimum Viable Product.

questions.question: Which phase focuses on identifying risks and possible obstacles?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The planning phase includes identifying risks and possible obstacles.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Risk identification happens during the planning phase.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the implementation phase?
answers: To implement technical aspects of the project
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The implementation phase is focused on technical implementation.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The implementation phase is about implementing the technical aspects.

questions.question: Why should no magic work be done outside the project's Git repository during implementation?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The GitOps approach emphasizes all work being tracked in Git.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The GitOps approach requires all work to be tracked in the Git repository.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key activity during the review phase?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A final retrospective is an important part of the review phase.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The correct answer is conducting a final retrospective.

questions.question: What does 'Make it work, then make it right, then make it fast' imply?
answers: Always make it fast before testing
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The phrase implies focusing on functionality before optimization.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The correct interpretation is to focus on functionality over optimization.

questions.question: Which agile planning methodology could be used for a DevOps capstone project?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Scrum is an agile planning methodology commonly used in DevOps.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Scrum is a suitable agile methodology for a DevOps project.

questions.question: Why is pairing required for the capstone project?
answers: To work with someone more experienced
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Pairing with someone more experienced is crucial for learning and guidance.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Pairing is required to work with someone more experienced.

questions.question: What should be the outcome of the requirements phase?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The requirements phase defines the project scope and objectives.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The outcome should be defining the project scope and objectives.

questions.question: Which of the following should be documented in the implementation phase?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The entire implementation process should be documented.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The implementation phase requires complete documentation.

questions.question: What should success metrics (KPIs) define?
answers: How project success will be measured
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! KPIs are used to define how success will be measured.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Success metrics (KPIs) define how success will be measured.

questions.question: What is the goal of a final retrospective?
answers: To assess the outcomes and identify improvements
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A retrospective is to assess outcomes and improvements.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The goal is to assess outcomes and identify future improvements.

questions.question: Which of these is an important part of the risk assessment phase?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Identifying unknown obstacles is a key part of risk assessment.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Identifying unknown obstacles is a key part of risk assessment.

questions.question: Which approach does the capstone project follow regarding project development?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The project follows the GitOps approach.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The project follows the GitOps approach.

questions.question: What should be done during the review phase to validate the project?
answers: Verify and validate each plan phase
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Each plan phase should be verified and validated during the review.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Verifying and validating each plan phase is key in the review.

questions.question: What is a reasonable approach when facing obstacles during project planning?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Documenting and assessing risks is the right approach.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Risks should be documented and assessed.

questions.question: What is the role of a project roadmap?
answers: To outline the high-level sequence of work
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The roadmap outlines the high-level sequence of work for the project.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The project roadmap outlines the high-level sequence of work.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a good MVP?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A good MVP includes core functionality to deliver value.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. A good MVP focuses on delivering core functionality.

questions.question: What is the importance of defining non-functional requirements?
answers: They specify how the system should perform
They are not important in DevOps
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Non-functional requirements specify how the system should perform.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Non-functional requirements specify system performance attributes.

questions.question: Why is documentation crucial during the implementation phase?
answers: To ensure team members understand the implementation
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Documentation ensures that all team members understand the implementation.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Documentation helps team members understand the implementation.

questions.question: How should obstacles identified in the planning phase be addressed?
answers: By assigning them to a junior developer
By changing the project scope entirely
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Obstacles should be addressed by creating a mitigation plan.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Obstacles should be managed with a mitigation plan.

questions.question: What is the purpose of defining functional requirements?
answers: To determine what the system should do
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Functional requirements define what the system should do.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Functional requirements define what the system should do.

questions.question: What is a key benefit of using GitOps in a DevOps project?
answers: Centralized version control for all operations
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! GitOps provides centralized version control for operations.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. GitOps uses centralized version control for all operations.

questions.question: Which of the following should be the focus when making a project 'right'?
answers: Adding as many features as possible
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Making it right involves improving functionality and maintainability.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The focus should be on improving functionality and maintainability.
